OOG.content: math-object the exemplary object of phenomenology

ideal objects, absolutely constitutive > marks a transcendental prehistory; p. 41 re: geometrical concept, history can only be empirical (i.e. Kant); p. 43 re: sense & value of what we cognize, phenomenology is indifferent to heritage.
OOG.linkedContent: ideal objects, absolutely constitutive > marks a transcendental prehistory; p. 41 re: geometrical concept, history can only be empirical (i.e. Kant); p. 43 re: sense & value of what we cognize, phenomenology is indifferent to heritage.

OOG.content: indissociability, rigorously determinable phenomenological sense: from static reduction to historical one.
OOG.linkedContent: indissociability, rigorously determinable phenomenological sense: from static reduction to historical one.

OOG.content: when investigating origins of geometry, decidability is reduced, along w/ each determined factual stage of history > to indicate the pure openness and unity of an infinite horizon [Derrida refers to undecidablity of truth not bound by “true” or “false”]
OOG.linkedContent: when investigating origins of geometry, decidability is reduced, along w/ each determined factual stage of history > to indicate the pure openness and unity of an infinite horizon [Derrida refers to undecidablity of truth not bound by “true” or “false”]

OOG.content: for phenomenology, senses of sense is determined as object, available for regard or gaze, final category of everything can appear, that can be for pure consciousness
OOG.linkedContent: for phenomenology, senses of sense is determined as object, available for regard or gaze, final category of everything can appear, that can be for pure consciousness

OOG.content: objects join all regions to consciousness, the Ur-region
OOG.linkedContent: objects join all regions to consciousness, the Ur-region

OOG.content: a method that confuses itself with the source, so source goes unquestioned
OOG.linkedContent: a method that confuses itself with the source, so source goes unquestioned

OOG.content: original presentive intuition: both an activity & passivity
OOG.linkedContent: original presentive intuition: both an activity & passivity

OOG.content: phenomenology stretched btwn finitizing consciousness of its principle & infinitizing consciousness of its final institutions: the Endstiftung indefinitely deferred in its content but evident in its regulative value
OOG.linkedContent: phenomenology stretched btwn finitizing consciousness of its principle & infinitizing consciousness of its final institutions: the Endstiftung indefinitely deferred in its content but evident in its regulative value

OOG.content: no phenomenology of Idea, it is the possibility of evidence and openness of “seeing” itself [see Husserl quote on p. 139]
OOG.linkedContent: no phenomenology of Idea, it is the possibility of evidence and openness of “seeing” itself [see Husserl quote on p. 139]

OOG.content: phenomenology: starts from a lived anticipation [Idea in Kantian sense would be operative not thematic] as radical responsibility absent in Kant
OOG.linkedContent: phenomenology: starts from a lived anticipation [Idea in Kantian sense would be operative not thematic] as radical responsibility absent in Kant

OOG.content: phenomenological determination of Idea radically impossible: Logos can’t be given in philosophy of seeing, but (like all Speech) can only be understood in visible > Endstiftung of phenomenology (its ultimate legitimation) never directly measures up to phenomenology
OOG.linkedContent: phenomenological determination of Idea radically impossible: Logos can’t be given in philosophy of seeing, but (like all Speech) can only be understood in visible > Endstiftung of phenomenology (its ultimate legitimation) never directly measures up to phenomenology

OOG.content: the Endstiftung can be announced in a concrete phenomenological evidence
OOG.linkedContent: the Endstiftung can be announced in a concrete phenomenological evidence

OOG.content: phenomenological attitude, attention for the “future of a truth which is always already announced”
OOG.linkedContent: phenomenological attitude, attention for the “future of a truth which is always already announced”

OOG.content: “access to Being and Being’s arrival must always already be contracted [stricture] or drawn together when phenomenology begins by claiming the right to speak (droit à parole)” > prescribing historicity for Being avoids simple misfortune of delay: phenomenology alone can open absolute subjectivity of Sense to Being-History, as auto-temporalization of Living Present
OOG.linkedContent: “access to Being and Being’s arrival must always already be contracted [stricture] or drawn together when phenomenology begins by claiming the right to speak (droit à parole)” > prescribing historicity for Being avoids simple misfortune of delay: phenomenology alone can open absolute subjectivity of Sense to Being-History, as auto-temporalization of Living Present

OOG.content: delay is thus philosophical absolute, and absolute origin in general
OOG.linkedContent: delay is thus philosophical absolute, and absolute origin in general

OOG.content: impossibility of resting in simple maintenance [nowness] of a Living Present, the absolutely absolute origin always other in its self-identity, Absolute is present only in being deferred-delayed (différant), this impotence is given in a primordial and pure consciousness of Difference, a difference that announces its form with apriori security > gives all factual profusion
OOG.linkedContent: impossibility of resting in simple maintenance [nowness] of a Living Present, the absolutely absolute origin always other in its self-identity, Absolute is present only in being deferred-delayed (différant), this impotence is given in a primordial and pure consciousness of Difference, a difference that announces its form with apriori security > gives all factual profusion

OOG.content: thus Difference as Thought as pure certainty > transcendental: “such a certainty never had to learn that Thought would always be to come”
OOG.linkedContent: thus Difference as Thought as pure certainty > transcendental: “such a certainty never had to learn that Thought would always be to come”

SPOM.content: via Marx, all phenomenology is phenomenology of spirit, cannot hide its Christian vocation
SPOM.linkedContent: via Marx, all phenomenology is phenomenology of spirit, cannot hide its Christian vocation

SPOM.content: phenomenological ego is a specter, phanesthai is the possibility of the specter, brings death, gives death, works at mourning [see pp. 237-38n Husserl’s noeme, irréellité]
SPOM.linkedContent: phenomenological ego is a specter, phanesthai is the possibility of the specter, brings death, gives death, works at mourning [see pp. 237-38n Husserl’s noeme, irréellité]

SPOM.content: phenomenological good sense “may perhaps be valid” for use-value, or only for use-value, phenomenology of good sense, of perception (at work in Marx), of Enlightenment, has nothing mysterious about it, use-value as the proper of man
SPOM.linkedContent: phenomenological good sense “may perhaps be valid” for use-value, or only for use-value, phenomenology of good sense, of perception (at work in Marx), of Enlightenment, has nothing mysterious about it, use-value as the proper of man

A.content: Heidegger’s methodologically rigorous choice to start from “this side” [phenomenology] goes hand in hand w/ what prevails, the pré-férance of pre-archic originarity of proper, eigentlich
A.linkedContent: Heidegger’s methodologically rigorous choice to start from “this side” [phenomenology] goes hand in hand w/ what prevails, the pré-férance of pre-archic originarity of proper, eigentlich

A.content: irreducible prescriptivity in mode of phenomenological attestation (Bezeugung) > one can and must testify to it
A.linkedContent: irreducible prescriptivity in mode of phenomenological attestation (Bezeugung) > one can and must testify to it

EM.content: for Heidegger, exemplary being is “phenomenological,” governed by principle of principles, i.e. presence and presence in self-presence, manifested in being we are, such proximity determines factum
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, exemplary being is “phenomenological,” governed by principle of principles, i.e. presence and presence in self-presence, manifested in being we are, such proximity determines factum

EM.content: Derrida’s attention to system and structure, la réduction du sens, neither restores classical motifs nor erases them > rather, determining possibility du sens on basis of “formal” organization which in itself has no sens: a critique [sic] of phenomenologies (Husserl, Hegel), which aspire for une réduction au sens
EM.linkedContent: Derrida’s attention to system and structure, la réduction du sens, neither restores classical motifs nor erases them > rather, determining possibility du sens on basis of “formal” organization which in itself has no sens: a critique [sic] of phenomenologies (Husserl, Hegel), which aspire for une réduction au sens

VM.content: imperialism of theoria bothers Levinas: especially phenomenology’s infusion w/ light, way it predetermined Being as object
VM.linkedContent: imperialism of theoria bothers Levinas: especially phenomenology’s infusion w/ light, way it predetermined Being as object

VM.content: acc. Levinas, Husserl misunderstands Descartes’ 3<sup><small>rd</small></sup> meditation, places infinite entirely w/in subjectivity, so phenomenology cannot account for ethics
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, Husserl misunderstands Descartes’ 3rd meditation, places infinite entirely w/in subjectivity, so phenomenology cannot account for ethics

VM.content: metaphysics unable to escape its ancestry in light, always supposes phenomenology in its critique of phenomenology [re: Levinas]
VM.linkedContent: metaphysics unable to escape its ancestry in light, always supposes phenomenology in its critique of phenomenology [re: Levinas]

VM.content: Levinas (tries to) take(s) phenomenology beyond its noetico-noematical structure
VM.linkedContent: Levinas (tries to) take(s) phenomenology beyond its noetico-noematical structure

VM.content: Idea in Kantian sense [Husserl] as infinite overflowing of horizon, never equal to intuition of an object, even God’s intuition [?]
VM.linkedContent: Idea in Kantian sense [Husserl] as infinite overflowing of horizon, never equal to intuition of an object, even God’s intuition [?]

VM.content: in phenomenology there’s no constitution of horizons only horizons of constitution
VM.linkedContent: in phenomenology there’s no constitution of horizons only horizons of constitution

VM.content: if infinity of Husserlian horizon has form of indefinite opening, doesn’t this keep it from totalization, from immediate present? is not intentionality respect itself? eternal irreducibility of other to same > w/out phenomenon of other as other no respect, respect supposes phenomenality, and ethics, phenomenology
VM.linkedContent: if infinity of Husserlian horizon has form of indefinite opening, doesn’t this keep it from totalization, from immediate present? is not intentionality respect itself? eternal irreducibility of other to same > w/out phenomenon of other as other no respect, respect supposes phenomenality, and ethics, phenomenology

VM.content: phenomenology neutralizes political commandments, foreign to all hierarchies, opened to infinity # of evident-truths
VM.linkedContent: phenomenology neutralizes political commandments, foreign to all hierarchies, opened to infinity # of evident-truths

VM.content: phenomenology, passageway to essentiality, would be impossible w/out anticipation [presupposition, metaphysical decision] of Being not exhausted by reality
VM.linkedContent: phenomenology, passageway to essentiality, would be impossible w/out anticipation [presupposition, metaphysical decision] of Being not exhausted by reality

VM.content: is phenomenology really different from Platonic, metaphysical, idealism? Husserl would say yes, Plato hypostasized idea by not understanding it as noema
VM.linkedContent: is phenomenology really different from Platonic, metaphysical, idealism? Husserl would say yes, Plato hypostasized idea by not understanding it as noema

VP.content: phenomenology’s “principle of all principles” > evidentness, present or presence of originary intuition
VP.linkedContent: phenomenology’s “principle of all principles” > evidentness, present or presence of originary intuition

VP.content: resource of phenomenological critique is the metaphysical project itself, wanting to restore philosophia protē; even though Husserl says phenomenology “excludes all metaphysical adventure, all speculative excess”
VP.linkedContent: resource of phenomenological critique is the metaphysical project itself, wanting to restore philosophia protē; even though Husserl says phenomenology “excludes all metaphysical adventure, all speculative excess”

VP.content: last court of appeal for phenomenology is “consciousness,” possibility of the self-presence of the present in the living present
VP.linkedContent: last court of appeal for phenomenology is “consciousness,” possibility of the self-presence of the present in the living present

VP.content: phenomenology (MOP in form of ideality) is also a philosophy of life, death is an empirical and extrinsic accident, everything is light, living light, blazes open passage to reduction
VP.linkedContent: phenomenology (MOP in form of ideality) is also a philosophy of life, death is an empirical and extrinsic accident, everything is light, living light, blazes open passage to reduction

VP.content: rigorous distinction btwn indication and expression (which are intimately associated) is only possible through juridical and phenomenological means: the analysis occurs in hiatus btwn fact & right, essence & existence, reality and intentional function
VP.linkedContent: rigorous distinction btwn indication and expression (which are intimately associated) is only possible through juridical and phenomenological means: the analysis occurs in hiatus btwn fact & right, essence & existence, reality and intentional function

VP.content: phenomenology at once the reduction of naïve ontology and the continuation of a metaphysics of presence
VP.linkedContent: phenomenology at once the reduction of naïve ontology and the continuation of a metaphysics of presence

VP.content: why phenomenology belongs to metaphysics: exteriority of indication in relation to expression
VP.linkedContent: why phenomenology belongs to metaphysics: exteriority of indication in relation to expression

VP.content: to understand phenomenology must be vigilant to difference btwn imagination of word and (imagined) word > way to emphasize non-reality of presence, transcendental experience
VP.linkedContent: to understand phenomenology must be vigilant to difference btwn imagination of word and (imagined) word > way to emphasize non-reality of presence, transcendental experience

VP.content: Being as non-reality, non-existence, Ideal > this pre-determination is the first word of phenomenology
VP.linkedContent: Being as non-reality, non-existence, Ideal > this pre-determination is the first word of phenomenology

VP.content: “principle of principles” > non-signification, absence and uselessness of sign in originary intuition
VP.linkedContent: “principle of principles” > non-signification, absence and uselessness of sign in originary intuition

VP.content: phenomenological reduction requires temporalization and is limited by it; phenomenological reduction is a scene
VP.linkedContent: phenomenological reduction requires temporalization and is limited by it; phenomenological reduction is a scene

F.content: phenomenology’s method: intentional analysis, phenomenological reduction, discounting constituted theses, return to actual constituting operations [Abraham sought passageway through phenomenology toward psychoanalysis]
F.linkedContent: phenomenology’s method: intentional analysis, phenomenological reduction, discounting constituted theses, return to actual constituting operations [Abraham sought passageway through phenomenology toward psychoanalysis]

F.content: phenomenology’s content: intersubjectivity, time, iteration, teleology, the original hulé
F.linkedContent: phenomenology’s content: intersubjectivity, time, iteration, teleology, the original hulé

POS.content: juridically decisive for Derrida to pose question of privilege of voice in Western metaphysics, represented in its most critical, vigilant form: Husserl’s transcendental phenomenology
POS.linkedContent: juridically decisive for Derrida to pose question of privilege of voice in Western metaphysics, represented in its most critical, vigilant form: Husserl’s transcendental phenomenology

ATIA.content: properly phenomenological logic of “I am” means there is only “I think” > breath, life are secondary: “I breathe, therefore I am” concludes nothing > indubitability of existence depends on thought (not being-in-life)
ATIA.linkedContent: properly phenomenological logic of “I am” means there is only “I think” > breath, life are secondary: “I breathe, therefore I am” concludes nothing > indubitability of existence depends on thought (not being-in-life)

GSP.content: via Husserl, phenomenologists are true positivists, metaphysicians and empirical sciences commit sin of explanationism
GSP.linkedContent: via Husserl, phenomenologists are true positivists, metaphysicians and empirical sciences commit sin of explanationism

GSP.content: phenomenologist as “true positivist”: self-effacing before originality, primordiality of meanings > faithful comprehension of phenomenologist dispels shadow of a choice (might even say Husserl attuned to historicity of meaning, possibility of its becoming)
GSP.linkedContent: phenomenologist as “true positivist”: self-effacing before originality, primordiality of meanings > faithful comprehension of phenomenologist dispels shadow of a choice (might even say Husserl attuned to historicity of meaning, possibility of its becoming)

GSP.content: certain atemporal fixedness in phenomenological ideal objectivity as concerns subjective becoming (Logical Investigations)
GSP.linkedContent: certain atemporal fixedness in phenomenological ideal objectivity as concerns subjective becoming (Logical Investigations)

GSP.content: the way Husserl moves from fixed (Ideas I) to genetic constitutions w/out breaking phenomenological continuity > unearthed “structural a prioris” of genesis itself
GSP.linkedContent: the way Husserl moves from fixed (Ideas I) to genetic constitutions w/out breaking phenomenological continuity > unearthed “structural a prioris” of genesis itself

GSP.content: phenomenology born from attempt & failure to reconcile structure (comprehensive description of totality) w/ genesis (search for origin of structure) [?]
GSP.linkedContent: phenomenology born from attempt & failure to reconcile structure (comprehensive description of totality) w/ genesis (search for origin of structure) [?]

GSP.content: neither structure, which isolates objective signification, nor genesis which effects abusive transitions from one region to the other, clarifies Husserl’s problem: foundation of objectivity
GSP.linkedContent: neither structure, which isolates objective signification, nor genesis which effects abusive transitions from one region to the other, clarifies Husserl’s problem: foundation of objectivity

GSP.content: to point to prior circumscription of natural regions (domains of objectivity) in utilization of notions genesis and structure can only be derived from phenomenological critique > thus it is always rightfully primary
GSP.linkedContent: to point to prior circumscription of natural regions (domains of objectivity) in utilization of notions genesis and structure can only be derived from phenomenological critique > thus it is always rightfully primary

GSP.content: radicalization of presuppositions history & psychology made phenomenology necessary

the attempt parallelism makes to overcome invisible difference is not innocent: for Husserl, the nothing of a parallelism prevents transcendental phenomenology & phenomenological psychology from coming together, this nothing permits transcendental reduction: permits origin of world to appear
GSP.linkedContent: the attempt parallelism makes to overcome invisible difference is not innocent: for Husserl, the nothing of a parallelism prevents transcendental phenomenology & phenomenological psychology from coming together, this nothing permits transcendental reduction: permits origin of world to appear

GSP.content: genetic description of ego prescribes task of a universal genetic phenomenology (a eidos of historicity) for Husserl, this is not a series of ruptures, revolutions, that tear open a previous finitude to lay bear a hidden infinity, giving voice to dynamis of silence > the ruptures are always already indicated [Telos] [Derrida wonders if this a metaphysical affirmation in a phenemonology]
GSP.linkedContent: genetic description of ego prescribes task of a universal genetic phenomenology (a eidos of historicity) for Husserl, this is not a series of ruptures, revolutions, that tear open a previous finitude to lay bear a hidden infinity, giving voice to dynamis of silence > the ruptures are always already indicated [Telos] [Derrida wonders if this a metaphysical affirmation in a phenemonology]

GSP.content: Telos/Vorhaben > infinite theoretical anticipation & infinite practical task: Kantian Idea as project of phenom.? makes it possible by overflowing its system (as its end?) > doesn’t enclose genesis of Being & meaning—is structurally genesis itself: origin/becoming, birth of history
GSP.linkedContent: Telos/Vorhaben > infinite theoretical anticipation & infinite practical task: Kantian Idea as project of phenom.? makes it possible by overflowing its system (as its end?) > doesn’t enclose genesis of Being & meaning—is structurally genesis itself: origin/becoming, birth of history

GSP.content: to ask about meaning of structure or genesis, is to ask what precedes phenomenological reduction, to ask about possibility of question itself— ask about its [phenomenology’s] own death
GSP.linkedContent: to ask about meaning of structure or genesis, is to ask what precedes phenomenological reduction, to ask about possibility of question itself— ask about its [phenomenology’s] own death

GSP.content: Husserl: phenomenology of ego’s self-constitution coincides w/ phenomenology as a whole
GSP.linkedContent: Husserl: phenomenology of ego’s self-constitution coincides w/ phenomenology as a whole

FS.content: philosophy, twilight of forces, “sun-splashed” morning of images, forms, phenomena
FS.linkedContent: philosophy, twilight of forces, “sun-splashed” morning of images, forms, phenomena

RGE.content: phenomenology of mind (phenomenology in general) correspond to restricted economy, restricted to commercial values, “science dealing w/ utilization of wealth”: circuit of reproductive consumption, limited to established value of objects and their circulation
RGE.linkedContent: phenomenology of mind (phenomenology in general) correspond to restricted economy, restricted to commercial values, “science dealing w/ utilization of wealth”: circuit of reproductive consumption, limited to established value of objects and their circulation

RGE.content: absolute production and destruction of value escapes phenomenology as restricted economy
RGE.linkedContent: absolute production and destruction of value escapes phenomenology as restricted economy

AFR.content: Condillac, replaces a metaphysics of essences (the hidden) w/ metaphysics of phenomena (the open)
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac, replaces a metaphysics of essences (the hidden) w/ metaphysics of phenomena (the open)

LI.content: plenitude of intentional meaning (vouloir-dire), meaningfulness, consciousness, presence, originary intuition > all organize phenomenology [what Derrida is questioning]
LI.linkedContent: plenitude of intentional meaning (vouloir-dire), meaningfulness, consciousness, presence, originary intuition > all organize phenomenology [what Derrida is questioning]

TN.content: pure psychology parallels pure transcendental phenomenology

“principle of principles” gives us no choice [?]: commands us to begin w/ “us,” that is, w/ most proper, proximate Ego; this “man,” this “we” comes before most radical phenomenological reduction, the one that suspends the world
TN.linkedContent: “principle of principles” gives us no choice [?]: commands us to begin w/ “us,” that is, w/ most proper, proximate Ego; this “man,” this “we” comes before most radical phenomenological reduction, the one that suspends the world

TN.content: teleological hierarchy, axiological scale: phenomenology begins w/ man
TN.linkedContent: teleological hierarchy, axiological scale: phenomenology begins w/ man

TN.content: Husserl: man filled w/ soul through & through
TN.linkedContent: Husserl: man filled w/ soul through & through

TN.content: German mit translated as en même temps > temporal coincidence gives intuitive plenitude (immediacy of time can’t be thematized—only argued by paralipsis [?])
TN.linkedContent: German mit translated as en même temps > temporal coincidence gives intuitive plenitude (immediacy of time can’t be thematized—only argued by paralipsis [?])

TN.content: Husserl: “originally” not used here in temporal-causal sense but refers to “a primal group of Objects constituted directly in intuition (direkt anschaulich)”
TN.linkedContent: Husserl: “originally” not used here in temporal-causal sense but refers to “a primal group of Objects constituted directly in intuition (direkt anschaulich)”

TN.content: phenomenology finds greatest resistance where extension, place, localization are at issue > nous abordons ainsi une zone de spatialité, extension of the psyche
TN.linkedContent: phenomenology finds greatest resistance where extension, place, localization are at issue > nous abordons ainsi une zone de spatialité, extension of the psyche

TN.content: for Husserl, duplicity of sensible impression/apprehension occurs via a certain necessary exteriority, an outside as “real quality of a thing” (it partakes even in illusions)
TN.linkedContent: for Husserl, duplicity of sensible impression/apprehension occurs via a certain necessary exteriority, an outside as “real quality of a thing” (it partakes even in illusions)

TN.content: if foreign outside, space of material thing, slips btwn touching/touched, i.e. the heterogeneity of spacing > won’t a hand touching itself experience this detour?
TN.linkedContent: if foreign outside, space of material thing, slips btwn touching/touched, i.e. the heterogeneity of spacing > won’t a hand touching itself experience this detour?

TN.content: Nancy: phenomenology touches/exceeds its own limit in Cartesian Meditations > “pré-donation of the alter-ego”
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: phenomenology touches/exceeds its own limit in Cartesian Meditations > “pré-donation of the alter-ego”

AD.content: “ethics beyond the political”: interruption of self (in phenomenology, by phenomenology itself), phenomenology surprises, suspends itself > paradoxical reverting to “ethics beyond the political”
AD.linkedContent: “ethics beyond the political”: interruption of self (in phenomenology, by phenomenology itself), phenomenology surprises, suspends itself > paradoxical reverting to “ethics beyond the political”

OG.content: that nonpresentation is as “originary” as presentation for Husserl is why thought of trace cannot break nor be reduced to transcendental phenomenology: no choice (élection) here, to make it seem like there is, is to confuse very different levels, paths, styles
OG.linkedContent: that nonpresentation is as “originary” as presentation for Husserl is why thought of trace cannot break nor be reduced to transcendental phenomenology: no choice (élection) here, to make it seem like there is, is to confuse very different levels, paths, styles

OG.content: is phenomenological time (dialectic of protention/retention) still mundane? still linear?
OG.linkedContent: is phenomenological time (dialectic of protention/retention) still mundane? still linear?

EU.content: Husserlian phenomenology, incomparable rigor—not Sartre, not Merleau-Ponty
EU.linkedContent: Husserlian phenomenology, incomparable rigor—not Sartre, not Merleau-Ponty
